title: NFL Win Probability Engine (Monte Carlo)
description: A high-performance C++ simulation engine. It takes a game state (Score, Time Remaining, Down, Distance) and runs 10,000 simulations to calculate the win probability for the possession team.

title: nflverse Data Ingestion (Safety Valve)
description: A memory-safe CLI tool written in Rust. It downloads massive CSV dumps from nflverse (Play-by-Play data), validates the schema using Serde, and batches inserts into Postgres 10x faster than Python.

title: Fantasy Point Projector
description: A Python microservice that uses `nfl_data_py` to fetch last week's player stats, calculates rolling averages, and projects fantasy points for the upcoming week using a simple linear regression model.

title: The League API (Gateway)
description: The central API Gateway for the platform. Exposes endpoints for `/players`, `/teams`, and `/games`. Demonstrates efficient ORM usage (`select_related`) to handle nested roster data without N+1 query issues.

title: Historical Stat Warehouse
description: A complex SQL schema optimized for analytical queries. Includes partitioning strategies for storing 20+ years of play-by-play data and views for calculating 'Yards After Catch' leaders efficiently.

title: Live Score WebSocket Hub
description: A high-concurrency Go service that simulates a live game feed. It broadcasts 'Touchdown' events to thousands of connected frontend clients via WebSockets with minimal latency.

title: Live Fantasy Draft Board
description: A polymorphic React component that displays a drag-and-drop fantasy draft board. Demonstrates complex state management (Context API) and performance optimization (memoization) when rendering hundreds of player cards.

title: The Stadium (Infrastructure)
description: The complete Infrastructure-as-Code definition for the platform. Provisions a cost-effective EC2 instance, bootstraps a K3s Kubernetes cluster, and configures Traefik ingress for traffic routing.

title: League Ops Pipeline
description: A sophisticated GitHub Actions pipeline that runs linting, unit tests (PyTest, GTest, Cargo Test), builds multi-stage Docker images, and pushes them to the registry on every commit.

title: Scaling E-Commerce Traffic
description: A retrospective case study on how I improved organic search traffic for Honey Whisker by 40% using structured data (JSON-LD) and Core Web Vitals optimization.

title: NFL Rulebook Assistant (RAG)
description: A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) tool. It uses `pgvector` to index the official NFL Rulebook PDF and allows users to ask natural language questions like 'What is the penalty for roughing the passer?'

title: The Engineering Atlas (Docs)
description: This documentation site itself. Built with Astro Starlight to demonstrate 'Docs-as-Code' principles, Islands Architecture for performance, and a custom MDX pipeline.

title: Unified Data Graph
description: The Federation layer that stitches together the Django API (REST) and the Go Microservices into a single queryable graph. Allows the frontend to request `Game { homeTeam { roster { name } } }` in one request.

title: Bitwise Register Simulator
description: A standalone C++ utility that simulates memory-mapped hardware registers. Demonstrates setting, clearing, and toggling specific bits using bitwise operators (`and`, `|`, `^`, `<<`) without overhead.

title: Server Hardening Playbook
description: An Ansible Role that locks down a fresh Linux Install: disables Root SSH, configures UFW firewall, installs Fail2Ban, and sets up auto-updates.

title: Universal C++ Build System
description: A complex `CMakeLists.txt` configuration that conditionally compiles platform-specific code for Windows (MSVC) and Linux (GCC) from a single source tree.

title: Legacy Qt Dashboard (Screenshot)
description: A showcase of a previous industrial control dashboard built with Qt Widgets. (Note: Code is proprietary, this is a recreation/screenshot to demonstrate the skill).

title: HoneyWhisker.com
description: The flagship implementation of the HoneyWhisker SEO strategy. Features programmatic content clusters and high-performance Core Web Vitals.
